pr_title: GG-29644: DR: Incremental state transfer index.

timeline.message:
WIP.
- Create partition log tree.
- Create new pageIO version.
- Fix page upgrade code.

timeline.author: korlov42
korlov42
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -50,7 +50,7 @@ public GridCacheVersionEx() {
      * @param dataCenterId Data center ID.
      * @param drVer DR version.
      */
-    public GridCacheVersionEx(int topVer, long order, int nodeOrder, byte dataCenterId,
+    public GridCacheVersionEx(int topVer, long order, int nodeOrder, byte dataCenterId, long updateCntr,

timeline.author: korlov42

timeline.bodyText: Why do you make it public?
timeline.author: korlov42
korlov42

timeline.bodyText: It worth to place all update-log-tree-related classes under tree.updatelog package
timeline.author: korlov42

timeline.bodyText: Looks like this code was copy-pasted from AbstractPendingEntryInnerIO without changes
timeline.author: korlov42

timeline.bodyText: Could we reuse storeByOffset here? At the first glance it could cost us unnecessary object creation, but IMO JIT will inline it.
timeline.author: korlov42

replies.bodyText:
I think "inlining" in this particular case doesn't mentioned in JMM spec.
Who will "inline" this in runtime? C1 or C2. Any proof?
What if user disable C2  due to any reasons?
replies.author: AMashenkov

timeline.author: korlov42

timeline.bodyText: please format this as noted above
timeline.author: korlov42

timeline.bodyText: assert cmp == 0 && row.link != 0 && io.getLink(pageAddr, idx) == row.link;
timeline.author: korlov42

timeline.bodyText: h2ExtraInnerIOs is a constant now, hence it should be named with underscore
timeline.author: korlov42

timeline.bodyText:
So, these are io versions specific for GG, right?
Was this discussed with Technical Decisions Approval team?
timeline.author: ibessonov
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -46,7 +46,8 @@
     /** */
     public static final IOVersions<PagePartitionMetaIO> VERSIONS = new IOVersions<>(
         new PagePartitionMetaIO(1),
-        new PagePartitionMetaIOV2(2)
+        new PagePartitionMetaIOV2(2),
+        new PagePartitionMetaIOV2(Short.toUnsignedInt((short)-1)) // Prevent partition usage on old versions after upgrade.

replies.bodyText:
Sure, we discussed this with Alex Goncharuk and concluded
as we can't reserve version number in Ignite, then we will use negative versions in GG CE.
This looks a bit tricky due to lack of PageIO's flexibility.
replies.author: AMashenkov

timeline.bodyText: You upgrade to version 3 using V2 class, is that ok? Also, space after ) is redundant.
timeline.author: ibessonov

replies.bodyText:
Got it.
I'll create a separate class for new version.
replies.author: AMashenkov

timeline.bodyText:
Hate to say this but I believe that new version of object won't be deserialized properly on old nodes when RU enabled.
It'll try to read field "drVer" but "updateCounter" is found. "u" goes after "d" in alphabet, so reader will assume that "drVer" field is removed and will nullify it. Have you tested it? Am I wrong?
We need to make sure that this code is 100% safe.
timeline.author: ibessonov

replies.bodyText:
Sounds sad. I believe it is safe to add new fields.
I'll check this.
replies.author: AMashenkov

replies.bodyText: Cool, now it works for sure!
replies.author: ibessonov

timeline.message: Styles. Move new IO version to separate class.
